Hi Mariana and All,

 

With respect to the renewal request , the same clause will be dealt in the lease agreement to be signed with D3. As per the standard terms and conditions the Renewal Clause stated the following :

 



 



 

 

On the other note , Under Dubai's rent law, the renewal of a lease agreement is governed primarily by Law No. (26) of 2007, as amended by Law No. (33) of 2008. Here are the key points related to the renewal of a lease:

 

1. Notice of Renewal or Non-renewal: If a landlord or tenant wishes to amend or not renew the lease, they must notify the other party at least 90 days prior to the expiration of the term, unless a different period is agreed upon in the contract.

 

2. Tenancy Contract: Upon renewal, the terms of the existing tenancy contract will generally continue to apply, unless both parties agree to new terms.

 

3. Rent Increases: Any rent increase upon renewal must comply with the Rental Increase Calculator established by RERA (Real Estate Regulatory Agency). The rent increase is subject to a percentage cap which is determined by the current market rates compared to the original rent.

 

4. Right to Renew: Tenants typically have a right to renew their lease, provided they have complied with the terms and conditions of the tenancy agreement, unless the landlord has a legitimate reason for not renewing the contract, such as the need to occupy the property for new development which will affect the Premises and he needs to submit proof and permits and licenses.

4. Right to Renew: Tenants typically have a right to renew their lease, provided they have complied with the terms and conditions of the tenancy agreement, unless the landlord has a legitimate reason for not renewing the contract, such as the need to occupy the property for new development which will affect the Premises and he needs to submit proof and permits and licenses.
